intro: Tarenaya microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited tarenaya, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and small, showy flowers that bloom in clusters. Tarenaya microcarpa typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
